description:
In a land where corruption rules and a ruthless Prime Minister has turned the puppet Emperor's armies of soldiers, assassins and secret police against the people, only one force dares to stand against them: Night Raid, an elite team of relentless killers, each equipped with an Imperial Arm - legendary weapons with unique and incredible powers created in the distant past.

Rescued from a fate worse than death by Night Raid, young Tatsumi is offered the chance to join their lethal ranks… but it's a deadly choice, as few can master an Imperial Arm and even fewer survive when two Arms go against each other in combat. The battle is on, and only the strongest will make it out alive.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

name.native: セリュー・ユビキタス

node.description:
He founded the adult game brand [Minato Soft](http://minatosoft.com/t4p/) in 2006.

[Website](http://www.takahiro.ms/index.htm) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takahiro4p)

**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Height:__ 160 cm

[Website](http://www.amamiyasora.jp/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/amamiya_sora) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/amamiyasorablog/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc4xpujLxnUBSI1XX-SdldQ) | [Second YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2oaLFNojVzLwQaA5KJOy3g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amamiyastaff) 

While a sophomore in high school, Amamiya was introduced to a video collection of roles of voice actress [Miyuki Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/95099). Following this, Amamiya decided to become a voice actress.

Amamiya, together with [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479) and [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818), passed an audition held by Music Ray'n in 2011, with the three making their voice acting debut in 2012. She made her official music debut for Music Ray'n by performing Akame ga Kill's opening theme "Skyreach." In late 2014, Amamiya, Asakura, and Natsukawa formed the music unit [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), which released its first single "Youthful Dreamer," used as the opening theme to the anime television series Ultimate Otaku Teacher, on May 13, 2015.

Amamiya, together with [Reina Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/118602) and [Aya Suzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/114834), received the Best New Actress award at the 9th Seiyu Awards in March 2015.
